title: Fritz Nachmann
text: Fritz Nachmann (born 16 August 1929) is a West German former <a href="luge">luge</a>r who competed during the 1950s and the 1960s. He was born in <a href="Kreuth">Kreuth</a>. He won the bronze medal in the men's doubles event at the <a href="1968%20Winter%20Olympics">1968 Winter Olympics</a> in <a href="Grenoble">Grenoble</a>. Nachmann also won five medals at the <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships">FIL World Luge Championships</a> with four medals in men's doubles (gold: <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201957">FIL World Luge Championships 1957</a>, <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201958">FIL World Luge Championships 1958</a>; silver: <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201962">FIL World Luge Championships 1962</a>, bronze: <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201955">FIL World Luge Championships 1955</a>) and one medal in men's singles (gold: <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201963">FIL World Luge Championships 1963</a>). He also won a silver medal in the men's singles event at the <a href="FIL%20European%20Luge%20Championships%201967">1967 FIL European Luge Championships</a> in <a href="Sch%C3%B6nau%20am%20K%C3%B6nigsee">Königssee</a>, <a href="West%20Germany">West Germany</a>.
